title: 3-torus
summary: The three-dimensional torus, or 3-torus, is defined as any topological space that is homeomorphic to the Cartesian product of three circles, T 3 = S 1 × S 1 × S 1 . {\displaystyle \mathbb {T} ^{3}=S^{1}\times S^{1}\times S^{1}.} In contrast, the usual torus is the Cartesian product of only two circles.
